text: <!channel> I’ve had a few questions about the project presentation. `There is no project presentation`  Truly, there are far too many teams for it to be practical. I wish there was time, but still you do have the opportunity to express your conclusions and experiences in your “report”. Many teams do create a presentation using powerpoint, keynote, prezi, whatever but it’s not required. Excellent reports can get bonus points, though (see Emily Strong’s report, for example).

I was asked a question about logging in a direct channel. Basically, the question was “can I replace _log4j_ with `System.out.println`?” My answer: well, I suppose so, but _log4j_ is much more elegant--and doesn’t get in the way of your program. Still, it’s more important to get the GA working and then, perhaps later, change to use _log4j_.

<@U8RFVCE7P> commented on <@U8SF2FJ0P>’s file <https://info6205-03-37196.slack.com/files/U8SF2FJ0P/FA5RZA5KM/projectreport.docx|ProjectReport.docx>: Bear in mind that Emily did the project alone and did an excellent job of covering all of the requirements. However, a many of the two-person teams did a much more presentation-oriented report and so I do expect more from two-person teams.

initial_comment.comment: Here is my report from my genetic algorithm project from last semester to give you an idea of what they should look like

comment.comment: Bear in mind that Emily did the project alone and did an excellent job of covering all of the requirements. However, a many of the two-person teams did a much more presentation-oriented report and so I do expect more from two-person teams.
